thread.title: Shocking footage shows children playing on crumbling cliff-top in Norfolk | Anglia
thread.title_full: Shocking footage shows children playing on crumbling cliff-top in Norfolk | Anglia - ITV News

author: itv.com
title: Shocking footage shows children playing on crumbling cliff-top in Norfolk | Anglia
text:
Play video Video report by ITV's Dani Crawshaw New footage has emerged of two youngsters playing on a crumbling cliff-top in Norfolk.
A runner captured the shocking moment on camera near the golf club at Sheringham on the north Norfolk coast on Sunday (19 February).
The children were seen dangling their legs over the edge, before sliding down to the bottom.
When the runner shouted across to make sure they were okay and told them it was dangerous, they simply replied: "we know."
The incident happened at Sheringham. Credit: EDP The local coastguard have reiterated that landslides can happen at any moment, and that it's not uncommon for a quarter of an acre to dislodge in the space of a few hours.
"The problem is that it looks fairly benign, and there are lots of tracks that are up and down the cliffs," Senior Coastal Operations Officer Anthony Gorbutt told ITV News Anglia.
"People always think their ability is better than it really is.
"If we get large storms, the sea can erode the cliff overnight."
Brendan Lavery died at Thorpeness in Suffolk in January. Credit: ITV News Anglia The incident comes just a month after a man died in Suffolk after a cliff collapsed onto him. He was trapped underneath the landslide.
Now, the coastguard are desperate to remind people that cliffs are not a playground and that they should keep their distance.
Cliff fall victim died of 'massive multiple injuries' Last updated Wed 22 Feb 2017 Norfolk
